intro: Athrixia athrixioides, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its compact form and winter flowering habit. Athrixia athrixioides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
